description: Palm sedge (Carex muskingumensis 'Wachtposten') is an amazing plant. Perfect for both gardens and wild spaces, this hardy, low-maintenance species is a unique standout in its native habitats of New England and eastern Canada. Not only is it drought-tolerant, it is also known for its feathery green foliage which resembles the shape of a handcrafted palm leaf. Its textured, unique appearance never fails to attract attention and stands out among other garden plants. This sedge works great as edgings and in planters and rock gardens, adding a tropical touch to the outdoors.
